defs.docs: Backend-agnostic interface for writing apps using [`egui`].

attributes.value: / Backend-agnostic interface for writing apps using [`egui`].
/ `epi` provides interfaces for window management, serialization and http requests.
/ An app written for `epi` can then be plugged into [`eframe`](https://docs.rs/eframe),
/ the egui framework crate.
/ Start by looking at the [`App`] trait, and implement [`App::update`].
forbid(unsafe_code)

warn(clippy :: all, clippy :: await_holding_lock, clippy :: char_lit_as_u8,
       clippy :: checked_conversions, clippy :: dbg_macro, clippy ::
       debug_assert_with_mut_call, clippy :: doc_markdown, clippy ::
       empty_enum, clippy :: enum_glob_use, clippy :: exit, clippy ::
       expl_impl_clone_on_copy, clippy :: explicit_deref_methods, clippy ::
       explicit_into_iter_loop, clippy :: fallible_impl_from, clippy ::
       filter_map_next, clippy :: float_cmp_const, clippy ::
       fn_params_excessive_bools, clippy :: if_let_mutex, clippy ::
       imprecise_flops, clippy :: inefficient_to_string, clippy ::
       invalid_upcast_comparisons, clippy :: large_types_passed_by_value,
       clippy :: let_unit_value, clippy :: linkedlist, clippy ::
       lossy_float_literal, clippy :: macro_use_imports, clippy ::
       manual_ok_or, clippy :: map_err_ignore, clippy :: map_flatten, clippy
       :: match_on_vec_items, clippy :: match_same_arms, clippy ::
       match_wildcard_for_single_variants, clippy :: mem_forget, clippy ::
       mismatched_target_os, clippy :: missing_errors_doc, clippy ::
       missing_safety_doc, clippy :: mut_mut, clippy :: mutex_integer, clippy
       :: needless_borrow, clippy :: needless_continue, clippy ::
       needless_pass_by_value, clippy :: option_option, clippy ::
       path_buf_push_overwrite, clippy :: ptr_as_ptr, clippy ::
       ref_option_ref, clippy :: rest_pat_in_fully_bound_structs, clippy ::
       same_functions_in_if_condition, clippy :: string_add_assign, clippy ::
       string_add, clippy :: string_lit_as_bytes, clippy :: string_to_string,
       clippy :: todo, clippy :: trait_duplication_in_bounds, clippy ::
       unimplemented, clippy :: unnested_or_patterns, clippy :: unused_self,
       clippy :: useless_transmute, clippy :: verbose_file_reads, clippy ::
       zero_sized_map_values, future_incompatible, nonstandard_style,
       rust_2018_idioms)
allow(clippy :: float_cmp)
allow(clippy :: manual_range_contains)

defs.name: App
defs.docs:
Implement this trait to write apps that can be compiled both natively using the [`egui_glium`](https://crates.io/crates/egui_glium) crate,
 and deployed as a web site using the [`egui_web`](https://crates.io/crates/egui_web) crate.

attributes.value: / Implement this trait to write apps that can be compiled both natively using the [`egui_glium`](https://crates.io/crates/egui_glium) crate,
/ and deployed as a web site using the [`egui_web`](https://crates.io/crates/egui_web) crate.

defs.name: update
defs.docs:
Called each time the UI needs repainting, which may be many times per second.
 Put your widgets into a [`egui::SidePanel`], [`egui::TopBottomPanel`], [`egui::CentralPanel`], [`egui::Window`] or [`egui::Area`].

attributes.value: / Called each time the UI needs repainting, which may be many times per second.
/ Put your widgets into a [`egui::SidePanel`], [`egui::TopBottomPanel`], [`egui::CentralPanel`], [`egui::Window`] or [`egui::Area`].

defs.name: setup
defs.value: pub fn setup(&mut Self, &egui::CtxRef, &mut Frame, Option<&dyn Storage>)
defs.docs: Called once before the first frame.

attributes.value: / Called once before the first frame.
/ Allows you to do setup code, e.g to call `[egui::Context::set_fonts]`,
/ `[egui::Context::set_visuals]` etc.
/ Also allows you to restore state, if there is a storage.

defs.name: warm_up_enabled
defs.docs:
If `true` a warm-up call to [`Self::update`] will be issued where
 `ctx.memory().everything_is_visible()` will be set to `true`.

attributes.value: / If `true` a warm-up call to [`Self::update`] will be issued where
/ `ctx.memory().everything_is_visible()` will be set to `true`.
/ In this warm-up call, all painted shapes will be ignored.

defs.name: save
defs.value: pub fn save(&mut Self, &mut dyn Storage)
defs.docs: Called on shutdown, and perhaps at regular intervals. Allows you to save state.

attributes.value: / Called on shutdown, and perhaps at regular intervals. Allows you to save state.
/ On web the states is stored to "Local Storage".
/ On native the path is picked using [`directories_next::ProjectDirs::data_dir`](https://docs.rs/directories-next/2.0.0/directories_next/struct.ProjectDirs.html#method.data_dir) which is:
/ * Linux:   `/home/UserName/.local/share/APPNAME`
/ * macOS:   `/Users/UserName/Library/Application Support/APPNAME`
/ * Windows: `C:\Users\UserName\AppData\Roaming\APPNAME`
/ where `APPNAME` is what is returned by [`Self::name()`].

defs.name: on_exit
defs.docs: Called once on shutdown (before or after [`Self::save`])

attributes.value: / Called once on shutdown (before or after [`Self::save`])

defs.name: name
defs.docs: The name of your App.

attributes.value: / The name of your App.

defs.name: auto_save_interval
defs.docs: Time between automatic calls to [`Self::save`]

attributes.value: / Time between automatic calls to [`Self::save`]

defs.name: max_size_points
defs.docs: The size limit of the web app canvas.

attributes.value: / The size limit of the web app canvas.

defs.name: clear_color
defs.docs:
Background color for the app, e.g. what is sent to `gl.clearColor`.
 This is the background of your windows if you don't set a central panel.

attributes.value: / Background color for the app, e.g. what is sent to `gl.clearColor`.
/ This is the background of your windows if you don't set a central panel.

defs.name: NativeOptions
defs.value: NativeOptions { always_on_top, decorated, drag_and_drop_support, icon_data, initial_window_size, resizable, transparent }
defs.docs: Options controlling the behavior of a native window

attributes.value: / Options controlling the behavior of a native window

defs.name: always_on_top
defs.docs: Sets whether or not the window will always be on top of other windows.

attributes.value: / Sets whether or not the window will always be on top of other windows.

defs.name: decorated
defs.docs:
On desktop: add window decorations (i.e. a frame around your app)?
 If false it will be difficult to move and resize the app.

attributes.value: / On desktop: add window decorations (i.e. a frame around your app)?
/ If false it will be difficult to move and resize the app.

defs.name: drag_and_drop_support
defs.docs:
On Windows: enable drag and drop support.
 Default is `false` to avoid issues with crates such as cpal which
 uses that use multi-threaded COM API <https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/1524>

attributes.value: / On Windows: enable drag and drop support.
/ Default is `false` to avoid issues with crates such as cpal which
/ uses that use multi-threaded COM API <https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/1524>

defs.name: icon_data
defs.docs: The application icon, e.g. in the Windows task bar etc.

attributes.value: / The application icon, e.g. in the Windows task bar etc.

defs.name: initial_window_size
defs.docs: The initial size of the native window in points (logical pixels).

attributes.value: / The initial size of the native window in points (logical pixels).

defs.name: resizable
defs.docs: Should the app window be resizable?

attributes.value: / Should the app window be resizable?

defs.name: transparent
defs.docs:
On desktop: make the window transparent.
 You control the transparency with [`App::clear_color()`].
 You should avoid having a [`egui::CentralPanel`], or make sure its frame is also transparent.

attributes.value: / On desktop: make the window transparent.
/ You control the transparency with [`App::clear_color()`].
/ You should avoid having a [`egui::CentralPanel`], or make sure its frame is also transparent.

defs.docs: Image data for the icon.

attributes.value: / Image data for the icon.

defs.name: rgba
defs.docs: RGBA pixels.

attributes.value: / RGBA pixels.

defs.name: width
defs.docs: Image width. This should be a multiple of 4.

attributes.value: / Image width. This should be a multiple of 4.

defs.name: height
defs.docs: Image height. This should be a multiple of 4.

attributes.value: / Image height. This should be a multiple of 4.

defs.name: Frame
defs.docs: Represents the surroundings of your app.

attributes.value: / Represents the surroundings of your app.
/ It provides methods to inspect the surroundings (are we on the web?),
/ allocate textures, do http requests, and change settings (e.g. window size).

defs.name: is_web
defs.docs: True if you are in a web environment.

attributes.value: / True if you are in a web environment.

defs.name: info
defs.docs: Information about the integration.

attributes.value: / Information about the integration.

defs.name: tex_allocator
defs.value: pub fn tex_allocator(&mut Self) -> &mut dyn TextureAllocator
defs.docs: A way to allocate textures.

attributes.value: / A way to allocate textures.

defs.name: quit
defs.docs:
Signal the app to stop/exit/quit the app (only works for native apps, not web apps).
 The framework will not quit immediately, but at the end of the this frame.

attributes.value: / Signal the app to stop/exit/quit the app (only works for native apps, not web apps).
/ The framework will not quit immediately, but at the end of the this frame.

defs.name: set_window_size
defs.docs: Set the desired inner size of the window (in egui points).

attributes.value: / Set the desired inner size of the window (in egui points).

defs.name: repaint_signal
defs.docs: If you need to request a repaint from another thread, clone this and send it to that other thread.

attributes.value: / If you need to request a repaint from another thread, clone this and send it to that other thread.

defs.name: WebInfo
defs.docs: Information about the web environment (if applicable).

attributes.value: / Information about the web environment (if applicable).

defs.name: web_location_hash
defs.docs:
e.g. "#fragment" part of "www.example.com/index.html#fragment".
 Note that the leading `#` is included in the string.
 Also known as "hash-link" or "anchor".

attributes.value: / e.g. "#fragment" part of "www.example.com/index.html#fragment".
/ Note that the leading `#` is included in the string.
/ Also known as "hash-link" or "anchor".

defs.name: IntegrationInfo
defs.value: IntegrationInfo { web_info, prefer_dark_mode, cpu_usage, seconds_since_midnight, native_pixels_per_point }
defs.docs: Information about the integration passed to the use app each frame.

attributes.value: / Information about the integration passed to the use app each frame.

defs.name: web_info
defs.docs: If the app is running in a Web context, this returns information about the environment.

attributes.value: / If the app is running in a Web context, this returns information about the environment.

defs.name: prefer_dark_mode
defs.docs:
Does the system prefer dark mode (over light mode)?
 `None` means "don't know".

attributes.value: / Does the system prefer dark mode (over light mode)?
/ `None` means "don't know".

defs.name: cpu_usage
defs.docs:
Seconds of cpu usage (in seconds) of UI code on the previous frame.
 `None` if this is the first frame.

attributes.value: / Seconds of cpu usage (in seconds) of UI code on the previous frame.
/ `None` if this is the first frame.

defs.name: seconds_since_midnight
defs.docs:
Local time. Used for the clock in the demo app.
 Set to `None` if you don't know.

attributes.value: / Local time. Used for the clock in the demo app.
/ Set to `None` if you don't know.

defs.name: alloc_srgba_premultiplied
defs.value:
pub fn alloc_srgba_premultiplied(&mut Self, (usize, usize), &[egui::Color32])
-> egui::TextureId
defs.docs: Allocate a new user texture.

attributes.value: / Allocate a new user texture.
/ There is no way to change a texture.
/ Instead allocate a new texture and free the previous one with [`Self::free`].

defs.name: free
defs.docs: Free the given texture.

attributes.value: / Free the given texture.

defs.name: request_repaint
defs.docs:
This signals the [`egui`] integration that a repaint is required.
 This is meant to be called when a background process finishes in an async context and/or background thread.

attributes.value: / This signals the [`egui`] integration that a repaint is required.
/ This is meant to be called when a background process finishes in an async context and/or background thread.

defs.name: Storage
defs.docs: A place where you can store custom data in a way that persists when you restart the app.

attributes.value: / A place where you can store custom data in a way that persists when you restart the app.
/ On the web this is backed by [local storage](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/localStorage).
/ On desktop this is backed by the file system.
